CatDescriptText: Mrs. Osalee Brown, 831 Francis Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you approve of women bartenders?" answer reads: "I don't think so. For myself, I feel as though a woman is out of place serving drinks.  Personally, I don't approve of waitresses."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Osalee Brown, wearing light colored shirt and coat, standing with arms crossed smiling on Liberty Avenue in front of car with sign reading "Jennie's...",  and Jenkins Arcade, Downtown
